comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content:
The photograph is of Tadhg Devane (d.1968 aged 63), Portmagee, Co Kerry. He was a fisherman, boat-builder and, as read on his face by so many Flickr enthusiasts, a great character. The Devanes, like the tribe of Dan, abode in boats and came originally to Portmagee from Dingle. His daughter, Mary, and family and his niece, Helen, still live in Portmagee.

Many thanks to the owners, staff and customers of The Moorings Bar and Restaurant for making assurance of this identification double sure.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69587809@N05] I can't believe it! This is thrilling - so Tadhg would have been about 58 when this photo was taken? Did you show this picture to the Devanes or just in The Moorings?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69587809@N05] What [http://www.flickr.com/photos/int0lerant] said! :) Can't wait to get into work tomorrow to tell my colleagues about this (and how brilliant our Flickroonies are!), and to add the information to the NLI catalogue record for this photo! Ding, Ding, Ding! The NLI Flickr Bell is going like the clappers today. An exact date established for Up Sinn Féin and a name for this lovely Fisherman!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content:
National Library and Flickr enthusiasts:  I emailed picture to Gerard in Moorings today and when I called in this evening everyone had seen it, as it had been checked and rechecked. All sent me to the family to make assurance double sure.  

This is a modern picture by National Library standards, yet one can see positive identification begin its melancholy, long withdrawal from one's grasp.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69587809@N05] You're very good to double check! I showed this to some colleagues today, and they were just as thrilled. Everyone loves this photo, and it was so great to put a name to a much-loved face... Will you please thank Gerard and all in The Moorings from everyone at the National Library?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: Of course, everyone here is  grateful. Thanks a thousand times to the National Library of Ireland and Flickr for extending this wealth of photographic record to us down here in South Kerry.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69587809@N05] Not at all! We owe you and all at The Moorings a great debt of gratitude... You're now our honorary South Kerry consultant, so beware, I'll be after you for help!  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
